p: Total flavonoid content was measured following the method described by Islam et al. [ 32]. Two grams of honey was diluted into 10 mL methanol and filtered with a 0.45 µm sterile Millex filter (Merk, Bayswater, VIC, Australia). Then, 1 mL of the 20% honey solution ( w/ v) was added to 4 mL milli-Q water, followed by 0.3 mL of 5% NaNO 2 ( w/ v). After five min, 0.3 mL of 10% AlCl 3 ( w/ v) was added. Six min later, the mixture was neutralized with 2 mL of 1.0 mM NaOH solution and increased into 10 mL using water. The absorbance was recorded at 510 nm within 5 min using a Lambda 35 UV–vis spectrophotometer (Perkin Elmer, Waltham, MA, USA). Catechin standards ranging from 0 to 100 μg/mL were used to construct a calibration curve against a blank consisted of honey solution and methanol without AlCl 3.
